reviews.text: This hotel was great ! It has a fantastic location the rooms are very clean. The Pantheon is just round the block. The Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, collaseum are all within walking distance. The Vatican is a bus ride away. The only thing i would say is that the rooms are not very well decorated and the rooms are a bit dark. However the matresses are clean and the bathroom was very nice. I stayed in a single room with a queen bed and if you want to save on a bit of cash and your a couple this would be more than comfortable (room 10).
reviews.title: Would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Access from Ciampino is easy the Terravision bus take you to Termini and from Termini you can get the number 60 bus to Argentina. ...
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is central to everything would definitely recommend you stay there!
reviews.title: Classy place with great location

likes.disliked: — Long distance from front desk to room

reviews.text: Suheda (London)
reviews.title: Great Location....First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ideal - walk to everything. Lots of close restaurants and piazzas to enjoy in the evening. The rooms were clean, modern, quiet and large.
reviews.title: Pricey, but great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfectly located for the first time visitors as we were, the hotel is situated immediately behind the Pantheon and adjacent to the Piazza Minerva. More of a businessman's hotel, the rooms we found were very clean with all the conveniences. If you're considering a luxury hotel, this is not it...try the Hotel Minerva around the corner which has a more expansive lobby and reportedly great rooftop dining. However, what promps this review is the fantastic concierge at the Santa Chiara, Frederica. We read about the hotel from Karen Brown's travel book (a great resource) and followed up a correspondence via email with questions and requests. Frederica was prompt, knowledgable, fluent in English and throughout our correspondence and stay at the hotel was just great.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location and Great Concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An added thank you to the private car and driver she provided to us for a day trip to Pompei. Marco Tavola is with (--) Book him! He was a great conversationalist, licensed tour guide for Rome and best of all for a hot summer's day traveled in an air conditioned Mercedes car. I think he has since purchased a luxury Mercedes van. Again... book him.
reviews.title: Great Location, good hotel
Good Location at Good Price
reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location, had very nice corner room with beatiful windows to the Piazza.
Breakfast is very good indeed, much better than going to a cafe so be sure to book it.
reviews.title: Definitely would return

reviews.text: Staff is typically Roman - very upnose (especially to Americans - we Europeans are treated a little better ;-) ).
reviews.title: Beware staying here in warm months of the year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay at Santa Chiara. In the interim, we've stayed at others. I think S.C. is the best hotel we've found in Rome for location, service, breakfast, and rooms. We got a very good price through their website for our new, large room in the newly renovated area. Lovely, but also enjoyed the large older room we'd stayed in previously. Comfortable, king beds. We will return on our next visit.
reviews.title: Best location in Rome

reviews.text: The location couldn't be better - behind Pantheon but on a quiet street. There is a new section and an older one which was somewhat under renovation when I was there in Feb. All is clean and neat however. Family owned, so the staff is attentive. The breakfast IS a bit ordinary - canned fruit cocktail, weak coffee, but the value, attractive lobby, and steps from the action make it a good choice.
reviews.title: New rooms and old rooms

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is very good: right behind the Pantheon, so its a very good starting point for seeing some part of Rome. The service is good and the rooms are OK, but rather small. On the contrary, I would advise to take your breakfast somewhere else.
reviews.title: Good location, but not for breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel, near the pantheon is excellent. The breakfast menu is the best we have got in Italy. Rooms are clean and the staff is helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Excellent Breakfast, High Quality Room

reviews.text: Only thing which is miossing is free internet connectivity. Other than that I would definitely go back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful family albergo!

reviews.text: Our room was absolutely fabulous for our family of 5. We had one of their apartments located on the 4th floor that was quite large. The room had two levels, a state of the art bathroom , sitting area, walk in closet, and a large terrace to sit outside. It is a bit of a maize to get to the room but well worth it. Clean crisp sheets we loved on beds that were a bit hard. The room seemed completely sound proof of any noise. Even with our window open it was very quiet. Breakfast was fabulous with a wide variety of choices.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!

reviews.text: Location, location, location....walk to everything. The Pantheon is literally right behind the hotel. Santa Chiara is a gem.
reviews.title: Good Property, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely. Desk staff not overly friendly, but nice enough. The room we had (no smoking, 4th floor) was a bit difficult to get to. I actually got lost the first day..Room , by Italian standards, was good. Bathroom luxurious, but small. Shower was in a bathtub, and it was extremely high to step into. Amenities were good. Wifi was cheap, but.. only one person could use it at a time. We had to take turns checking emails, using internet.
reviews.title: A haven in the center of the hustle and bustle of Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, but.. the coffee was terrible. Luckily, around the corner was a great coffee place (tho closed on Sundays) The reason we chose this property was its locations, which was FABULOUS. One minute walk to the Pantheon, five min walk to Piazza Novona, a couple fore to get to the Trevi Fountain, a few more to the Spanish Steps. Also very convenient to walk (10 min max) to the Victor Emmanuel Monument , with the Formus and Coliseum a few moments further. We even walked to the Vatican very easily, and to Travestere. In short, never needed public transport during our 4 days there..
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Excellent Location

reviews.text: Only detriment was extremely loud street noise on weekend nights..due to the centrality of the location near the Pantheon.
reviews.title: Great Location, nice hotel

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for it's location, and it was as advertised. Everything important, except for the Vatican is located within in walking distance. The room was big for Italian standards, and extremely clean. The breakfast was good, even though it started a little later than normal in my opinion. The friendliness of the staff, was hit or miss. The desk clerks were curt and offered no help in any manner, but the support staff was very attentive to our requests and needs. I would have no problem booking this hotel again, and would recommend it to anyone interested in spending a little more to be close to all the action.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Spent a few days here to visit the archaeological sites in Rome. A nice hotel, friendly helpful staff, service excellent, breakfast very good and the rooms clean and comfortable. No idea of price since I was with a group.
reviews.title: Friendly and a good standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only drawback is the position. Coaches have to park couple of hundred yards away and the bus station is about a ten minute walk. Got lost several times trying to find the hotel in the dark although it is close to the Pantheon.
reviews.title: we loved this small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good hotel for the price - good location too. - would definately come back
reviews.title: Good quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 star hotels in Europe can be anything from great to horrible. This one is a good bet if you find the price acceptable. The rooms are clean and pleasant. The location is excellent: not only it is very central, it is quiet! The people working in reception are ok. Here is how I see it: they do not own the place and there is lack of leadership/ example of what good customer service means. In any case, it was not an issue for us as we are very independent travelers.
reviews.title: Aloof service sinks the experience

reviews.text: This is a great 3-star hotel, right in the heart of Rome. Location is hard to beat, a few steps from the Pantheon, piazza Navona, and major Rome's landmarks.
reviews.title: Hard to beat

reviews.text: My room was on the small side, but spotless and nicely designed.
reviews.title: Fantastic location made up for small room

reviews.text: Good breakfast, with lots of fresh fruit.
reviews.title: Excellent central city base for family

reviews.text: Tip: ask for a room in the new wing (just renovated).
reviews.title: Total indifference to guests

reviews.text: I recently got back from a eight day stay(June 24-July 2). I looked at various reviews, prices, reputation and central Rome where I could walk to most of the attractions. The hotel Santa Chiara filled the bill, even though it was on the high price approximately $175 per night including breakfast. The room consisted of a single bed, flat screen tv, desk, bar fridge- and the room was about the size of my walk-in closet back home in Toronto. (about 10x12) although it had a decent size bathroom with shower, bidet, The problem with the room was it was located on the first floor and there was a loose manhole cover just outside my window. The noise was terrible with cars hitting it and pedestrians walking on it. I managed to change rooms later and got another room on the other side but it had a view of a wall. Breakfast consisted of juices, fresh fruit, yogurt, meats, breads, cereals ,eggs and fresh coffee and expresso. I even noticed a few "priests" and "clergy" staying at the hotel. There were a few churches just steps away. I managed to walk to the Patheon, which was just in front of the hotel, Vatican City, Sistine Chapel, Colleseum, Trivi Fountain ,Plaza Navona, Spanish Steps and hundreds of monuments and churches. The staff seemed attentive to details and giving accurate directions. There was a small bar on the ground level and a outdoor patio for smoking. There was quite a good library of travel books which I often used in my planning. There is no need to lug around various books or a computer (which I didn't). The trip from the airport was fast and efficient and a driver was there to meet me once I arrived. The price was forty Euros,.
reviews.title: Upsetting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our second time in Rome and we wanted a hotel closer to Piazza Navona this time since that was one of our favorite Piazza's. This time we went with our "travel friends" who were visiting Rome/Europe for the first time. They loved this hotel as well, we spent evenings at a wine bar on the Pantheon square and loved how close the hotel was to this area. Staff was helpful with restaurant suggestions. I'm a shopper and there were multiple boutiques near the hotel also. We loved the breakfast. especially the warm Nutella croissants! We would drink wine in the comfortable lobby before going to dinner, relaxing after a day of sightseeing. We all agreed next time we are in Rome we will stay here again!
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great breakfast, nice staff, clean hotel!

reviews.text: It is always a good sign when the desk staff address you by name and give you your room key without asking! All staff were pleasnt and helpful. Our room was a good size with a reasonable sized bathroom. The room staff all greeted you in the corridors with a nice smile. The breakfast was plentiful - the coffee was from a machine but expressos and cappucinos were available on request. The croissants were excellent.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, good location

reviews.text: The hotel is within easy walking distance of a large number of historical sites and churches. Santa Maria Sopra Minerva across the square should not be missed. There are plentiful restaurants and pizzarias close by.
reviews.title: Very poor deal for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My jaw dropped when I saw the box like room and horrible back view. No bathtub as specified, just a shower. The room was overheated and impossible to correct despite fiddling with the thermostat. The controls can only be altered via computer at the concierge desk. The noise from the street at night prevented opening the window. A main drain nearby meant a noise like Niagrara Falls every time someone had a shower. I stayed for 4 nights before Easter week and the price was 205 euros per night for single use! I can only imagine everyone else staying was on a cheap deal but I booked several months ago. The hotel is totally devoid of character or comfort which would have been fine were it a budget hotel. Concierge service was distant and rude. I asked to change room and was told the hotel was fully booked. Wi fi was also said to be free but there was a charge in the bedroom. What is it with booking agencies giving inaccurate hotel information?
reviews.title: What a deal and a great place!

reviews.text: On the other hand the hotel was extremely clean and the breakfast excellent and complimentary (despite being told otherwise by Hotel.com so I nearly missed out). There was a comprehensive array of breakfast foods including parma ham/mozzarella and if you asked the waiter expresso/cappuccino also supplied (though not advertised)
reviews.title: Superb hotel in the centre of the old city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, so the room was small, but it we've paid more money for smaller ones. It was well laid out and easy to negotiate. The bed was comfortable. The air conditioning worked brilliantly during a very hot week in June. The staff was always helpful. The breakfast was good. And the location-----we only used a cab to and from the airport and one other time. We walked everywhere, including the Vatican Museum. When we return for our next visit to Rome, I won't even consider another hotel. This is the one.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!
Fantastico !!
reviews.text: We were absolutely delighted with our stay at Albergo Santa Chiara. Others have spoken, quite correctly, about the location. It's absolutely great. Breakfast? Terrific. Room? Very nice. But we want to sing the high praises of Federica, the concierge. Wow! She got us tickets we were told were sold out, made difficult to get reservations, gave directions, made recommendations, and tought us a little Italian on the side. She is absolutely terrific. We will stay here again when we go back to Rome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Albergo Santa Chiara twice. The location is top notch. The hotel is attractive. The rooms ware pleasant, clean and well finished. Breakfast was decent. But the Internet was inadequate, despite the charge or 10 Euros for 3 days. It was only available in common areas, and during busy times frequently cut out, or was temporarily unavailable. And, what is just as bad, the hotel staff simply did not care.
reviews.title: Good Location, Nice Hotel, Poor Internet

reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel - my husband and I loved our room, and the staff was very helpful. It is in a great location, and if you watch out for Rome taxi drivers who will charge tourists whatever they think they can get away with (which is anything if you can't argue in Italian!), you will love this hotel and city. The breakfast is very generous, the elevators a bit of an experience (!), and the reception staff makes great suggestions and gives directions kindly. Highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Wonderful spot to stay in Roma!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I returned to Albergo Santa Chiara for the second time. We stayed for three nights in September 2012. The location of this hotel is perfect as it is central to all of the sights we wanted to see. It is right behind the Pantheon. We enjoyed the breakfast, which is included in the price of the room. Our room was very clean and very comfortable, as well as quiet. The staff at the front desk was pleasant and helpful. We highly recommend Albergo Santa Chiara when you plan your visit to Rome.
reviews.title: Our second stay at Albergo Santa Chiara

reviews.text: Wonderful hotel - close to everything. The staff at the front desk can be a bit stuffy but the staff in the breakfast room are wonderful. When we walked in, they brought the latte's and the hot chocolates are the kids which were really amazing. I truly miss their wonderful chocolate croissants!! Ask for a higher floor as there is a bit of nightlife in Rome and you can hear some of the louder folks on the streets. *Rooms are nicely decorated and bathrooms are in great condition - all newly done. Easy walk to everything
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: We recommend this hotel. Our room had a pull out bed, 2 twin/full beds, large closet, good bathroom, fridge, bureau. Good air conditioning! The breakfast room is big, the lobby has a small bar area, an outdoor patio, large sitting area with windows to watch for taxi, and a library/ siting area with good tour books. The staff cool, but helpful. Directly behind the hotel is the Pantheon and plenty of shops. The location is safe and perfect for walking to all the famous fountains and squares.
reviews.title: Mom & 2 Teenagers, Good Location, Helpful Staff, Triple Room.

reviews.text: Albergo Santa Chiara is situated on a quiet street in an absolutely perfect location for walking to most of the major historical sites in Rome. It is on a quiet piazza that boarders the beautiful Santa Maria Sopra Minerva gothic church. It is also a couple of hundred yards from the Pantheon. The very capable concierge, Frederica, was key to our memorable Christmas and New Years stay in Rome. She worked with us before, during, & after our stay to secure reasonable airport transfers, as well as, unique event, tour and dinner reservations. Attention to detail and quality are prioritizes as she continued to inquire about our satisfaction with her recommendations. The reception and breakfast staff provided warm and efficient service as well. We will definitely return to this gem on our next visit to Rome!
reviews.title: hospitality & concierge bar none

reviews.text: We reserved a quad room, which had two twin beds in one room, a double bed in the other and a marble bathroom in between. The AC worked wonderfully well, it was cool, quiet (for the most part) and the breakfast was wonderful - Loved the apricot filled croissants and the easy cappuccino machine! The best was the location - everything was so easy to get to from here. There was even a tiny bus which stopped right outside to zip us up to the Borgese Gardens. So easy to walk around Rome from here. A little pricey, but worth it. The front desk was so pleasant - they so kindly arranged for our reservations at the Borgese Gallery, and for the taxi back to the airport all without a hitch.
reviews.title: Stay here!

reviews.text: The location of Albergo Santa Chiara couldn't be better, a block away from the Pantheon right in the heart of old Rome. You can walk to the coloseum in about 20 minutes and to the Vatican in about 30. The hotel itself would be a good choice even without the location. It's an old-style European hotel with a comfortable lobby and renovated rooms that are roomy by Italian standards. The bathrooms are small and functional. It's two buildings put together so the hallways are bit a quirky with some rooms requiring short stairs even after taking the elevator. We had a view onto a pretty church from our room. My only complaint is that the coffee at the otherwise solid breakfast buffet is lousy, but some of the best coffee in the world is available from bars a few paces away. The staff weren't effusively friendly, but were very capable at suggesting restaurants and handling messages. There's no restaurant or gym, but you can have drinks in the lobby. The wi-fi worked pretty well. It costs 4 euros an hour, 6 euros for six hours, and 10 euros for 24 hours. You don't have to use it continuosly, so an hour could be enough for a several day stay if you are just checking messages. Overall, if you can afford it, a great choice for work or tourism in Rome. Don't think of driving here. If you are coming to Rome by car, leave it in a garage on the outskirts and come here by taxi.
reviews.title: comfortable hotel, superb location
Great Rome Hotel
reviews.text: Perfect Location for exploring Ancient Rome - Pantheon. Lovely large room and bathroom. Excellent and immediate service when needed. Concierge very helpful. Felt cozy and cared for. Ample, diverse breakfast saved much time in the morning. Stayed for 6 nights - We shall return!
Very nice 3 star Hotel in great location.
reviews.title: Very Nice

likes.liked: — Location, included very good breakfast buffet

reviews.title: Molto Bene
reviews.text: Stayed in apartment #1 which had a lovely garden patio that would be great in warmer weather.
Frederica, concierge was most helpful.
reviews.title: dig this location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Santa Chiara for 6 nights last April when I was in Rome on business. Location was ideal - Near everything but somehow more authentic than other larger hotels. My (tiny) room faced the alley and felt removed from the tourist scene. Not a slick nor a luxurious property, but feels organic to what a home away from home in Rome should be. I did not pay for my room, but I believe it was very reasonable.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience at Albergo Santa Chiara!

likes.liked: — Our beautiful room so near to all the beautiful sites.
likes.disliked: — Can't think of a thing to mention.

reviews.text: I stayed at the S Chiara for a week this month, my sixth visit, in a room which the staff had remembered we liked from our last visit nearly 2 years ago. Yet again the staff were all friendly and helpful, the rooms scruplously clean and the service excellent. On the last night there was the mother and father of a thunderstorm and the electricity cut off to parts of the hotel, yet service continued as far as possible as normal, though with the porter continually travelling round the hotel to open the doors and maintaining his cheerful demeanor. Very many thanks to all at the hotel who helped to make our stay so enjoyable.
reviews.title: The wonderful S Chiara

reviews.text: David Breeze
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: Two friends and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We had a triple room which was clean, modern, comfortable and quiet. The beds were much more comfortable than beds we had experienced in other parts of Italy. The bathroom had a large tub/shower combination. Our room overlooked the terrace area and it was so quiet! The air conditioning worked perfectly. We never experienced crowding in the breakfast buffet area. We found the selection of pastries, cereals, juices and fruits as well as eggs, ham, cheese to be more than adequate. The location, a half block from the Pantheon, is centrally located for many sites in Rome. We felt safe walking in the area quite late at night. The hotel staff was very professional and polite. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Smart, comfortable hotel in perfect location.

reviews.text: Stayed with my husband, teenage son, & father in law to celebrate his 80th birthday. This was our 2nd stay at this hotel, having been there 8 years ago. Again it didn't disappoint. My husband and I had a double room with a sofa bed for our son, but was large enough to be called a suite in some hotels we've stayed in. My father in laws single room was quite small but had everything needed for a city break, being clean, up to date shower room, tv and fridge. The location is perfect, being directly behind the pantheon, so ideal for all the major sites and plenty of lovely eating places close by. The 116 bus even goes directly past the hotel, despite the narrow streets. The continental breakfasts were plentiful, with a selection of breads, rolls, croissants, ham, cheeses, jams, fruit, yoghurts, together with boiled & scrambled eggs, with coffee, tea & fruit juices. The staff were always helpful and the service good. Would definitely recommend this hotel. It's 3star rating doesn't do it justice.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: My daughter had a single and I had a double room for single occupancy .in the renovated section.This arrangement insured enough space and privacy for our week in Rome. The location in the heart of the historic district made it possible to walk almost everywhere. Many wonderful gelaterias and a wide selection of eating establishments were conveniently close. The Albergo was immaculate and well-run, although without any particular atmosphere or charm. Still it was good to escape to its quiet after the bustle and crowds of Rome. My room overlooked the street but was quiet as was my daughter's overlooking a terrace. Be aware that the shower is a tight squeeze. I am 5'8" , 140 pounds and managed. If you are taller or heavier be careful. The bed pillows took some getting used to, like sleeping on marble slabs. Right in keeping with what we saw in the church sarcophagi.You can use Wi-Fi for 10 euro for 24 hours over a 4 day period. In a week we spent 20 euro on Wi-FI. Breakfast before 9am meant competing with crowding at the buffet, but then Rome in October is extremely popular. A personal guide is highly recommended. We had Andrea Pollett (a.pollett@libero.it or AWT@andreapollett.com) for two afternoons, and were glad we did. He took us deep into the past in a scholarly and intriguing manner. Much more engaging than a guide book and a million times better than a group tour. Rome is expensive for dollar tourists but we found Albergo Santa Chiara a good value at 205 for a single and 250 euro for a double room,plus soggiorno tax.
reviews.title: Not a good value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location could not be better. The hotel and staff were very professional and high quality.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: I love this place the very moment I stepped into the hotel lobby. The staff were friendly and inviting and I was able to check into our room when I was there at 11am (check-in time was 1pm).
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Comfortable Rooms, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location.
reviews.title: Best landing place after arrival in Rome, charming and best continental breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very centrally located at a quiet street, just a few streets behind the Pantheon. Everything was very easily accessible. Piazza Navona is like 5 min walk away.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location, breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: Great Value, Wonderful Location

reviews.text: The location of this hotel was perfect for our Vatican, Pantheon and Plaza Novona walking visits. The staff and service was great, rooms were comfortable and sparking clean and there are many great places to eat and enjoy nearby. The breakfast offered was good and having a lounge, patio and sitting area made visiting with our traveling partners enjoyable. We marveled while enjoying outdoor dining and looking up at the Pantheon.
reviews.title: Hotel rating

reviews.text: I spent two nights at this hotel, in a perfectly adequate and clean single room, probably quite recently renovated. An 'internal' room, it was utterly quiet though had no view - in fact looked out onto a brick platform and wall covered with plastic leaves two feet away! This did not bother me in the least but what did was the lack of a working air-conditioning unit in Rome with 32 degrees celsius. I had purposely chosen this hotel for its location and the air-conditioning. There are others in the area I could have chosen. I complained each time (often) I passed reception and was repeatedly told that the technician was working on the problem. Both nights the temperature in my room was 26 degrees, whereas outside it was 18. I did not want to open the window for security reasons.
reviews.title: Air conditioning not working

reviews.text: Apart from this the hotel was wonderfully central and the staff, with a possible exception in the reception area, were polite and helpful, if not effusive. The crockery at breakfast had had a dishwasher problem and some of it was a bit gritty, but avoidable. Breakfast itself was quite satisfactory. There were many regular and obviously valued Italian guests. Downstairs in the public areas the air-con worked very well!
reviews.title: Very poor value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If the management had made some gesture of goodwill when it came to producing my bill I would not be writing this. Of course they did not. Next time I may go elsewhere.
reviews.title: Recent Stay in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Albergo Santa Chiara due to the positive reviews from Trip Advisor. We left after one night. For $350 a night, it was the most minimal room we had in our two week tour of Italy. The location is excellent, but the rooms were very small, everything fake, and very little resemblance to the pictures. There is simply no reason to pay that kind of money for what you get. Quite simply, it is a total rip-off. We went to Navona Piazza and paid a bit more, but got a whole lot more. I simply am amazed at some of the comments.
reviews.title: I would stay here again-great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at Albergo Santa Chiara because we see no reason to be anywhere else in Rome! We stayed two wonderful weeks at the best location in town. We could walk to all the sights we love most. Taxis always available. Every need met quickly, efficiently and with a smile. The desk people are ready to answer any question and solve any problem. - Frederica a gem - both before and after arrival - Piego always a charming greeter. Breakfast was a delight. Our room was comfortable, clean and spacious - the neighborhood a wonder. Good Value. We shall return.
reviews.title: Who could ask for anything else?

reviews.text: I own a travel company based in CA. I am forever checking out hotels in Italy, to add to a master list. Albergo Santa Chiara made the list.
reviews.title: A Hotel With A Winning Combination!
Wonderful hotel!
reviews.text: Clean, QUIET, and fantastically well located, we checked in to relish 7 nights, and 8 days in the backyard of the Pantheon, the heart of the historic center. The ASC staff is professional and dependable, from calling for a taxi, arranging transfers to and from the airport, dinner reservations and hard to get tickets to art exhibitions. They were helpful in every way and the breakfast buffet is the way to start your day in Rome.
I would not hesitate to book rooms at the ASC, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Good nights sleep...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I left another hotel that I did not like to come toAlbergo Santa Chiara. Perfect location. Lovely public lounges. Terrific breakfast. Helpful staff. Plan to book again when I am in Rome. The price of the Hotel was very reasonable. It had charm.
reviews.title: Great location, nice staff
Must be a different hotel
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on these reviews, and so far am bitterly disappointed. We barely rated a greeting on our arrival, had to return to the desk to seek our passports, and were given absolutely no information about the hotel: breakfast? Wifi? Neighborhood? A simple welcome? A smile? Nothing. All of guests I saw today, I including my family, were treated as interruptions. Not even a city map and a pat on the head. I still have no idea where or when breakfast can be had, and there is no hotel information in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also read about renovated rooms -- not this one. Our room is UGLY and cramped, with old 1960s furnishings, a musty carpet, an antique hair dryer, and an air conditioning vent that blows straight down onto the bed, guaranteed to make us sick. This may have been a storage room at one time. Have I made my concerns known? To whom?

reviews.text: We found this hotel through our travel agent. Upon arrival our room wasn't ready. They served us cappucino with biscotti on the outside terrace, while we waited. The location was great! The room was large and squeeky clean. The hotel staff was excellent. I highly reccommend this hotel and will return there again.

I found booking a hotel in Rome a daunting task - took a chance and booked this hotel based on the reviews we read. We had 5 days in Rome as a follow up to a cruise. The location is fantasitic, literally right next to the Pantheon - the area has limited car access which is heaven as it keeps the noise and dust down. Our room was quiet, the bedding wonderful, the AC perfect (so nice at the end of a long hot day), some English TV, the breakfast was good, and the staff extremely helpful and professional. Having 5 days, we compared this location with others and found it really great for access to all the sites plus the reduced noise factor was a major importance. Elevators are small, but that is Europe. We stayed on the 4th floor which we hiked to but we like any exercise. Our room opened up to small interior courtyard (no balcony), it was a triple with a comfy sofa bed (set a little back from the main area) that worked well for our 16 year old. It was spotless as well. Cab ride to airport is about 50 Euros (we chose a cab for a family of 3) and airport is about 35 minutes away. The hotel can you direct you to the small, inexpensive electric buses to get to some of the sites but we walked to most places except for Vatican and Borghese Villa Museum. Very good restaurants in area too. I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.text: We really enjoyed staying at the Santa Chiara. We spent four days there and were very satified. The room was tiny, but it was beautifully decorated and clean. The bathroom was also tiny, but it was spotless. The location was excellent, we could walk to almost everything we wanted to see and do. They had all the amenities. We found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant.

reviews.title: Best Little Hotel in Rome
reviews.text: The Hotel Albergo Santa Chiara is located within walking distance of almost every sight you'd want to see. If you walk north you're two blocks from the Pantheon, and about five minutes from Trevi Fountain, and a few more minutes to the Spanish Steps. If you walk due west, you're about five minutes from Piazza Navonna. A little south of Piazza Navonna is Campo Di Fiori - also about five minutes from the hotel. If you walk due south, you're about five minutes from Capitol Hill, and a few more minutes to the Forum, Colosseum and Palatine Hill. If you walk just a couple blocks south you're at the major route to the Vatican, with a taxi stand right there for you (you could walk to the Vatican, but that's about fifteen to twenty minutes...) But the location's not all - the people taking care of us were exceptionally friendly and made every coming and going a pleasure. The concierge made a couple phone calls for us to help us with plans. The hotel offers (and don't pass it up!) pick up and drop off from the airport, for a per person fee. Even the driver was fun and punctual - waiting at the airport with our name on a sign! And at the hotel for our departure at least fifteen minutes early - we were still eating breakfast! The breakfast was amazing, and the waiters were wonderful. By the third morning our capuccinos and espressos were delivered moments after we arrived without us asking! There were meats, cheeses, pastries, coffee, a significant variety of teas, hot milk, cereal, fruit, biscotti...all included in your hotel price. Just remember, the beds anywhere in Europe (not just Rome) are much harder than American standards - but in summer the hotel has a/c and we used our heater to warm us up in winter. The shower was adjustable for height and had great pressure and hot water...You simply cannot find a better hotel in Rome - unless you choose to pay a fortune, but if you're reading this - you won't.

The nearby Pantheon and the piazza just in front of it is worth seeing -- an ancient temple embedded in a still-vibrant & bustling neighborhood, charming lanes with great little shops, a couple of Michelin one-star restaurants, & fabulous architecture. Just don't assume that you'll get a room with a window. And if you have to engage the front-desk staff for any reason, good luck. It is their place, I reminded myself, because the sense of hospitality is just not there. For example, after I paid the bill, they simply turned away without saying anything. From the Piazza Santa Chiara, the Minerva Hotel certainly seems like a more appealing place.
reviews.title: Near the Pantheon, Standoffish staff

reviews.text: We loved our trip to Rome. Santa Chiara was in the best location possible. The Pantheon was in our backyard and we walked to the Vatican and the Coloseum. Rome is beautiful. Santa Chiara has a nice breakfast. The beds are hard, just like everywhere else in Italy, but the staff was extremely helpful. Would stay there again.
